data: For practice guidelines, refer to Decision Support Tool (DTS)
May be initiated only once per patient. If second dose is required at same or subsequent visit then contact MRP
Indication: Relief of discomfort during a difficult intravenous (IV) needle insertion or implantable venous access device (IVAD) access

Exceptions / Contraindications: 
- Patients with congenital or idiopathic methemoglobinemia (a blood disorder)
- Hypersensitivity to any of the other amide type anaesthetics (e.g., lidocaine, prilocaine, lignocaine, mepivicaine, cinchocaine, etidocaine)

Precautions / Special Considerations: 
- Do not apply to cuts, grazes, wounds or where there is a skin rash or eczema
- Do not rub the cream in
- Monitor the application site for degree of numbness
1 application, topical, once, drug form: cream, first dose: NOW
1 patch, topical, once, drug form: patch, first dose: NOW

Contraindication: 
hypersensitivity to local anesthetics of ester type. (e.g. benzocaine, choroprocaine, cocaine, procaine, proparacaine, tetracaine)
1 application, topical, once, drug form: top liq, first dose: NOW

Contraindications:
 - Sterile procedures
- Procedures that last more than 1 minute

Cautions: 
 - Do not use on patients with poor circulation or insensitive skin
- Do not use in conjunction with other local anesthetic products
injection/venipuncture
- Overspraying may cause frostbite
1 application, topical, once, drug form: top liq, first dose: NOW

Contraindications: 
- Hypersensitivity to any of the other amide type anaesthetics (e.g., lidocaine, prilocaine, lignocaine, mepivicaine, cinchocaine, etidocaine)
0.1 mL, intradermal, once, drug form: inj, first dose: NOW
Notify treating provider for ongoing therapy
